docs.abstract: From power bricks to cables, it’s time to incorporate USB-C or wireless charging into your setup.
docs.snippet: From power bricks to cables, it’s time to incorporate USB-C or wireless charging into your setup.
docs.lead_paragraph: Most of us own multiple types of chargers to replenish our devices. That’s because many products, like Apple phones and Microsoft Surface computers, are plugged in with wires that use unique connectors.

headline.main: What Europe’s Universal Charger Mandate Means for You
headline.print_headline: E.U.’s Rule on Chargers Means Big Changes

docs.abstract: A report published by Microsoft also found that Moscow’s disinformation campaign to establish a narrative of the war favorable to Russia was doing better than expected.
docs.snippet: A report published by Microsoft also found that Moscow’s disinformation campaign to establish a narrative of the war favorable to Russia was doing better than expected.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — A new examination of how Russia used its cybercapabilities in the first months of the war in Ukraine contains a number of surprises: Moscow conducted more cyberattacks than was realized at the time to bolster its invasion, but more than two-thirds of them failed, echoing its poor performance on the physical battlefield.

headline.main: Many Russian Cyberattacks Failed in First Months of Ukraine War, Study Says
headline.print_headline: Many of Moscow’s Cyberattacks to Fortify War Were Thwarted, Study Says

byline.original: By David E. Sanger and Julian E. Barnes

docs.abstract: The technology giant will stop offering automated tools that predict a person’s gender, age and emotional state and will restrict the use of its facial recognition tool.
docs.snippet: The technology giant will stop offering automated tools that predict a person’s gender, age and emotional state and will restrict the use of its facial recognition tool.
docs.lead_paragraph: For years, activists and academics have been raising concerns that facial analysis software that claims to be able to identify a person’s age, gender and emotional state can be biased, unreliable or invasive — and shouldn’t be sold.

headline.main: Microsoft Plans to Eliminate Face Analysis Tools in Push for ‘Responsible A.I.’
headline.print_headline: Microsoft to Delete Facial Analysis Tools From A.I.

docs.abstract: Microsoft will be disabling IE and directing Windows users to its modern Edge web browser in coming months. The news inspired jokes, memes and even some fond memories.
docs.snippet: Microsoft will be disabling IE and directing Windows users to its modern Edge web browser in coming months. The news inspired jokes, memes and even some fond memories.
docs.lead_paragraph: It was Aug. 16, 1995. “Waterfalls” by TLC was the No. 1 song in the country. Bill Clinton was in the White House. And Microsoft introduced a new way to surf the web: Internet Explorer.

headline.main: Internet Explorer Is Shutting Down in a Burst of Nostalgia
headline.print_headline: Final Flicker For Explorer, A Web Icon

docs.abstract: The accord could ease the path for thousands of workers to unionize at the game company, which Microsoft is acquiring, and addresses an antitrust objection.
docs.snippet: The accord could ease the path for thousands of workers to unionize at the game company, which Microsoft is acquiring, and addresses an antitrust objection.
docs.lead_paragraph: Microsoft and the Communications Workers of America union announced an agreement on Monday that would make it easier for employees to unionize at the video game maker Activision Blizzard, which Microsoft is acquiring for $70 billion.

headline.main: Microsoft Pledges Neutrality in Union Campaigns at Activision
headline.print_headline: Microsoft Vows Neutrality  In Activision Union Efforts

byline.original: By Noam Scheiber and Karen Weise
